metadata.goal_text: The student can distinguish between number lines divided into equal parts and number lines divided into unequal parts.

steps.dialogue: Here are two number lines from 0 to 1. One is divided into equal parts, and one isn't. Which one has equal parts?

prompt.text: Select the number line divided into equal parts.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Look for the [vocab]number line[/vocab] where both parts are the same size.

events.name: selected_compare
events.description: Compare parts of the selected shape

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. Equal parts means both sections are exactly the same size. [event:selected_compare] Look at the spacing between the marks on the [vocab]number line[/vocab] you chose.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the first or the top shape with equal parts

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to find equal parts. [event:A_compare] The first number line has two parts that are exactly the same size - from 0 to [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]one half[/fraction], and from [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]one half[/fraction] to 1. Each section takes up the same amount of space. That's what equal parts means.

on_correct.dialogue: That's right. You found the [vocab]number line[/vocab] with equal parts.

metadata.goal_text: The student can distinguish between number lines divided into equal parts and number lines divided into unequal parts.

steps.dialogue: Here are two number lines from 0 to 1. One has [vocab]equal intervals[/vocab], the other doesn't. Which one has unequal parts?

prompt.text: Select the number line with unequal intervals.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Check the spacing between the tick marks.

events.name: selected_compare
events.description: Compare parts of the selected shape

step.dialogue: Let's look more carefully. [event:selected_compare]Compare the distances between each tick mark on the [vocab]number line[/vocab] you selected. Are they all the same size?

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the first or the top shape with equal parts

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to tell the difference. [event:A_compare]On the second [vocab]number line[/vocab], look at the spaces between tick marks - see how some intervals are wider and some are narrower? That's what makes them unequal. The second number line has unequal intervals.

on_correct.dialogue: That's right. You identified the [vocab]number line[/vocab] with unequal intervals.

metadata.goal_text: The student can distinguish between number lines divided into equal parts and number lines divided into unequal parts.

steps.dialogue: Here are three number lines from 0 to 1. Each has tick marks, but only one is divided into equal parts.

prompt.text: Select the number line divided into equal parts.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Check the spacing between the tick marks.

events.name: selected_compare
events.description: Compare parts of the selected number line to show unequal spacing

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. For equal parts, [event:selected_compare] the distance between each [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] needs to be exactly the same.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all intervals of the first number line to demonstrate equal spacing

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to find equal parts. [event:A_compare] Look at the first [vocab]number line[/vocab] - see how the distance from 0 to the first tick, from the first tick to the second tick, and so on are all exactly the same? That's what equal parts means. Each [vocab]interval[/vocab] is the same size.

on_correct.dialogue: Correct. You identified the [vocab]number line[/vocab] with [vocab]equal intervals[/vocab].

metadata.goal_text: The student can distinguish between number lines divided into equal parts and number lines divided into unequal parts.

steps.dialogue: Here are three number lines from 0 to 1. Each has tick marks, but only two are divided into equal parts. Which one has unequal parts?

prompt.text: Select the number line with unequal parts.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Look closely at the spacing between the tick marks.

events.name: selected_compare
events.description: Compare parts of the selected shape

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. [event:selected_compare]Check the distances between each tick mark on the [vocab]number line[/vocab] you selected - are they all the same?

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the first or the top shape with equal parts

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to find unequal parts. [event:C_compare]On the third [vocab]number line[/vocab], notice how the spacing between tick marks changes - some gaps are wider and some are narrower. That's what makes the parts unequal. The first two number lines have consistent spacing throughout.

on_correct.dialogue: Correct. You identified the [vocab]number line[/vocab] with unequal spacing.

metadata.goal_text: The student can distinguish between number lines divided into equal parts and number lines divided into unequal parts.

steps.dialogue: Three number lines are shown here. Which one has equal spacing between all the ticks?

prompt.text: Select the number line with equal intervals.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Check the spacing between each [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] carefully.

events.name: selected_compare
events.description: Compare parts of the selected number line to highlight spacing differences

step.dialogue: Let's look more closely. [event:selected_compare]Compare the distances between the tick marks on the [vocab]number line[/vocab] you selected. Are they all the same?

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the correct number line (line_equal) to demonstrate equal spacing

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to find equal spacing. Look at the second [vocab]number line[/vocab].[event:B_compare] See how the distance between each [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] is exactly the same? That's what equal spacing looks like - every [vocab]interval[/vocab] is identical. That's the number line with equal parts.

on_correct.dialogue: Correct. That [vocab]number line[/vocab] has equal spacing between all tick marks.
